attributes.action: Allow 16-17 year olds to vote in elections
attributes.additional_details: There are many 16 year olds who want to be able to vote, myself included. There are many 18+ year olds who are not politically educated but are able to vote, and yet there are many 16-17 year olds who ARE politically educated, such as myself, but cannot vote. We want to be able to have a say on who runs our country, and not have our views disregarded simply because we're not deemed old enough to have informed opinions.
attributes.background: Lower the voting age to 16 years old. Many argue that people under 16 are not educated enough politically to make informed decisions. However, apparently we are educated enough to pay taxes? To get married? To start families? To give medical consent? Let us have a say on who runs our country.

rejection.details:
I'm sorry - we cannot accept duplicate petitions. We think this petition is similar to yours:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/104603

You might like to sign this petition instead. It is more likely to get more signatures that way.
